subject: RE: [junit] TestCase Dependency Hierarchy
msgSnippet: ... A ... object ... You know, hmm ....  that is a scary observation that stops me in my tracks, cos I feel I am about to slip. Am I doing this? Hmm, maybe I
messageBody:
john.link@... wrote:

> I agree as long as A is not a subclass of B. If A and B are simply two
> different objects then I tend to test them in independent environments. If
A
> simply needs to create object B because it gets information from that
object
> there are other ways to do this - plus that starts a slippery slope of
> munging unit tests with integration tests.

You know, hmm .... that is a scary observation that stops me in my tracks,
'cos I feel I am about to slip. Am I doing this? Hmm, maybe I am. At what
point does a unit test of an aggregating object, or subclass, become an
integration test? My head hurts.

regards

Adam
